page.title: 01CHALFONT AREA INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area covered in this project retains its old agricultural tendencies. Only one third of this area is heavily populated, encompassing the small town of Gerrards Cross, two small villages, Seer Green and Jordans and Chalfont St. Peter. A particularly interesting point about Chalfont St. Peter is that it is one of the largest villages in the country with a population of approximately 15,000. Gerrards Cross is a relatively new town, originally in the days of steam, it was a small hamlet, but after the arrival in the village of more sophisticated rail-travel in about 1906 Gerrards Cross grew quite quickly to its present size. Jordans is a very small village with a population of only 250. Seer Green is about 4 times the size of Jordans.
